data.message:
Welcome to Facebook. 

I am shocked by some of the things people have written on here. I'm not a Democrat, but I can be respectful towards the commander and chief, and to the office. Though I don't agree with certain policies and ideologies, that doesn't mean I am excused to be inconsiderate and rude.

Shame on you guys. And don't you realize that comments like that can get you flagged by the FBI? Come on, grow up.

Jesus bless.

replies.message: Whatever Rufus!  Since he has FB now, it's good or bad comments.  You don't like it, go away little man.
It's called free speech under the constitution
The term is "Commander in Chief" and he ain't one.
We all get harassed on facebook,he is no different.
Lol, you all are just proving his point.

I completely agree with you, Rufus. Such disrespect and obnoxious behavior gets us nowhere.

As the saying goes, "it is better to be thought a fool, than to open one's mouth and remove all doubt." If you can't speak with intelligence, to one of the most powerful and influential men in the country, then you shouldn't be speaking at all. It has nothing to do with rights, simply manners and basic rules of conduct.
Very well said Rufus, show respect, he is our president. I guess some people just don't know what respect is, and that is so sad.

I did not ask him to post to my Facebook page I did not search for his Facebook page I could care less how about what he likes or dislike
He was elected to do a job which is not being done.
I did not know the president was a Tour guide for the White House
It's called the First Amendment for a reason he should respect that as well
You have to earn respect and he hasn't.
This isn't about the office that he's abused. You put yourself on FB get ready to receive!
Tess you are even sadder !!!
JackPerdew needs to educate himself!
Jeebus?
Rufus you are a special kind of stupid.  You earn respect it's not given.  No traitor will ever get respect.

No one is disrespecting the president. We don't have one.  The respect goes to the office. Not necessarily the person occupying it.   He has shown no respect for anything this country stands for.  He and his buddy George Soros are to busy trying to dismantle it.
Like everyone else - he has to EARN respect!
To respect the authority, rank, position, you don't have to respect the person. Keep it respectful.
Yes let's not forget Big Brother is watching...FREE SPEECH!
I respect the United States and the office of the President.   The current occupier of the White House not so much

Reason why Rufus hasn't responded is because he finished his statement with Jesus Bless. Obama will have none of that language here and has now shipped them off to be beheaded by his brothers in ISIS.
You must earn the respect , it does not come with the title
How disrespectful, y'all are idiots..
give respect get respect . This person works for the people .Lets not forget this.
